_header: And sixty yen[?] barons full bold shall be brittened to death
_description: A political prophecy — forty-five alliterative lines

CULLl118.First Lines:
And lx yen larous full bolde shall be brittand to detheAnd iij
                    kn[i]ghtes full of care kyndely distroyed…
CULLl118.Last Lines:
…Þen shall þe ledeȝ be ladde forth to þe lawe
                    to abideWhat Iuggement þe Iustice will Iuge hem to have
CULLl118.Editions:
Day,  Mabel. 
             “Fragment from an Alliterative Political Prophecy.” 
             Review of English Studies
         15 (1939): 61-6: 63-4.
